noun.description: Mycology and Microbiology. Originally: an encysted myxamoeba with a thick, protective cell wall. Later also: a small, encapsulated resting cell produced by many myxobacteria.
Pathology. A microscopic or very small cyst.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Garnsey (1826–1903). From micro- + cyst, after German Microcyste.
